net.tinyos.prowler

Class Mica2Node

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.tinyos.prowler.Node
      • net.tinyos.prowler.Mica2Node
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    TestBroadcastNode

    public class Mica2Node
extends Node
    This class represents a mote and all its properties important from the simulation point of view. The MAC layer specific constant are all defined and used here.
    Author:
    Gyorgy Balogh, Gabor Pap, Miklos Maroti

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      double corruptionSNR
      The maximum signal to noise ratio below which a message is marked corrupted.

      The maximum noise level that is allowed on sending.

      The constant self noise level.

      The minimum signal to noise ratio required to spot a message in the air.

      The variable component of the backoff time.

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Mica2Node(Simulator sim, RadioModel radioModel)
      Parameterized constructor, it set both the Simulator in which this mote exists and the RadioModel which is used by this mote.

    • Field Detail

      • sendMinWaitingTime

        public static int sendMinWaitingTime
        The constant component of the time spent waiting before a transmission.

      • sendRandomWaitingTime

        public static int sendRandomWaitingTime
        The variable component of the time spent waiting before a transmission.

      • sendMinBackOffTime

        public static int sendMinBackOffTime
        The constant component of the backoff time.

      • sendRandomBackOffTime

        public static int sendRandomBackOffTime
        The variable component of the backoff time.

      • sendTransmissionTime

        public static int sendTransmissionTime
        The time of one transmission in 1/Simulator.ONE_SECOND second.

      • transmissionStrength

        public double transmissionStrength
        The strength of the radio signal emitted by the sender.

      • noiseStrength

        public double noiseStrength
        Noise generated by other nodes.

      • noiseVariance

        public double noiseVariance
        The constant self noise level. See either the calcSNR(double, double) or the isChannelFree(double) function.

      • maxAllowedNoiseOnSending

        public double maxAllowedNoiseOnSending
        The maximum noise level that is allowed on sending. This is actually a multiplicator of the noiseVariance.

      • receivingStartSNR

        public double receivingStartSNR
        The minimum signal to noise ratio required to spot a message in the air.

      • corruptionSNR

        public double corruptionSNR
        The maximum signal to noise ratio below which a message is marked corrupted.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Mica2Node

        public Mica2Node(Simulator sim,
         RadioModel radioModel)
        Parameterized constructor, it set both the Simulator in which this mote exists and the RadioModel which is used by this mote.
        Parameters:
        sim - the Simulator in which the mote exists
        radioModel - the RadioModel used on this mote

    • Method Detail

      • sendMessage

        public boolean sendMessage(java.lang.Object message,
                  Application app)
        Sends out a radio message. If the node is in receiving mode the sending is postponed until the receive is finished. This method behaves exactly like the SendMsg.send command in TinyOS.
        Specified by:
        sendMessage in class Node
        Parameters:
        message - the message to be sent
        app - the application sending the message
        Returns:
        If the node is in sending state it returns false otherwise true.

      • generateWaitingTime

        public static int generateWaitingTime()
        Generates a waiting time, adding a random variable time to a constant minimum.
        Returns:
        returns the waiting time in milliseconds

      • isMessageCorrupted

        public boolean isMessageCorrupted(double signal,
                         double noise)
        Tells if the transmitting media is free of transmissions based on the noise level.
        Parameters:
        signal - the signal strength
        noise - the noise level
        Returns:
        returns true if the message is corrupted

      • isReceivable

        public boolean isReceivable(double signal,
                   double noise)
        Tells if the incomming message signal is corrupted by another signal.
        Parameters:
        signal - the signal strength of the incomming message
        noise - the noise level
        Returns:
        returns true if the message is corrupted

      • isReceiving

        public boolean isReceiving()
        Returns true if the node is receiving a message.

      • isSending

        public boolean isSending()
        Returns true if the node is sending a message. This encapsulates the transmitting phase as this is a flag that shows if the message buffer is full.

      • isSendingPostponed

        public boolean isSendingPostponed()
        Returns true if the message sending was postponed due to high radio traffic.

      • isTransmitting

        public boolean isTransmitting()
        Returns true if the node is in transmitting mode, if this flag is true then the Mica2Node link is true as well.

      • isCorrupted

        public boolean isCorrupted()
        Returns true if the last message got corrupted during the receiving process.

      • getListenerApplication

        public SnifferIF getListenerApplication()
        Returns the listener application which sniffs packages.

      • setListenerApplication

        public void setListenerApplication(SnifferIF application)
        Sets the listener application which will receive all the messages received by the node.

      • removeListenerApplication

        public void removeListenerApplication()
        Removes the listener application.

      • getTransmissionStrength

        public double getTransmissionStrength()
        Returns:
        Returns the transmission strength for this node. This value is between 0 and 1.0 .

      • setTransmissionStrength

        public void setTransmissionStrength(double d)
        Parameters:
        the - new transmission strength to be used by this node.
